    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Main()
      Graph constructor The graph represent the map, summits are roads and edge are the points where robots need to take a decision This map is represented in a joined file (called "Final map.png") To change the map or hospital position, modifications have to be done here Be careful: in a cross, the second summit by alphabetic order has to be the shorter

    • Constructor Detail

      • Main

        public Main()
        Graph constructor The graph represent the map, summits are roads and edge are the points where robots need to take a decision This map is represented in a joined file (called "Final map.png") To change the map or hospital position, modifications have to be done here Be careful: in a cross, the second summit by alphabetic order has to be the shorter

        Initialize the root layout

        Initialize the drawing of the map

      • start

        public void start(javafx.stage.Stage primaryStage)
        Initialize the robots, the objectives and create the graph With that implementation, there will be 2 robots and 5 victims
        Specified by:
        start in class javafx.application.Application
        Parameters:
        primaryStage: - the stage that will contain the animation

      • main

        public static void main()
        Launch the application

      • initPrintRobot

        public void initPrintRobot(Robot robot)
        Create the circle and the text associated to a particular robot, and associate them to the robot
        Parameters:
        robot: - the robot to be printed

      • printRobotMovement

        public void printRobotMovement(double length,
                               Coordinates oldC,
                               Coordinates newC,
                               ISummit currentSummit,
                               boolean isALine,
                               Robot robot,
                               java.lang.String objective)
        Print the movement of a given robot
        Parameters:
        length: - the time the robot will take to reach the next edge
        oldC: - the old position of the robot
        newC: - the new position of the robot
        currentSummit: - the road the robot will follow to move
        isALine: - it must be true if the road is represented by a line (all the summits except the external curves on cross)
        robot: - the robot that will move
        objective: - the name of the final destination of the robot (where it goes)

      • changeSummitColor

        public void changeSummitColor(ISummit currentSummit,
                              double delay)
        When a victim has been picked up, the summit has to change color from red to white
        Parameters:
        currentSummit: - the summit that has to change it color
        delay: - the delay to wait before to change the color

      • robotFinished

        public void robotFinished()
        Each robot will say when it finished to the main server, and the server will know if the simulation has ended or not
